content:
IEnumConnections Interface

In this Article

Manages the definition of the IEnumConnections interface.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("B196B287-BAB4-101A-B69C-00AA00341D07")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
public interface IEnumConnections

Remarks

For new development, use IEnumConnections.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Methods summary

Clone(IEnumConnections)

Creates a new enumerator that contains the same enumeration state as the current one.
Next(Int32,CONNECTDATA[],Int32)

Retrieves a specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.
Reset()

Resets the enumeration sequence to the start.
Skip(Int32)

Skips a specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.

Methods

  • Clone(IEnumConnections)

    Creates a new enumerator that contains the same enumeration state as the current one.

    public void Clone (out Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.IEnumConnections ec);

    Parameters

    • ec
      IEnumConnections

      When this method returns, contains a reference to the newly created enumerator. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

    Remarks

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Next(Int32,CONNECTDATA[],Int32)

    Retrieves a specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.

    public void Next (int cConnections, out Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.CONNECTDATA[] cd, out int cFetched);

    Parameters

    • cConnections
      Int32

      The number of CONNECTDATA structures to return in cd.

    • cd
      CONNECTDATA[]

      When this method returns, contains a reference to the enumerated connections. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

    • cFetched
      Int32

      When this method returns, contains a reference to the actual number of connections enumerated in cd.

    Remarks

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Reset()

    Resets the enumeration sequence to the start.

    public void Reset ();

    Remarks

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Skip(Int32)

    Skips a specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.

    public void Skip (int cConnections);

    Parameters

    • cConnections
      Int32

      The number of elements to skip in the enumeration.

    Remarks

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
